snippet: A German court said a 93-year-old man was charged with 170,000 counts of accessory to murder on allegations he served as an SS guard at the Nazis’ Auschwitz death camp in occupied Poland.
abstract: Germany’s Detmold state court alleges 93-year-old man was Nazi SS guard at Auschwitz death camp from 1942 to 1944 and charges him with 170,000 counts of accessory to murder; lawyer Johannes Salmen says his client, who remains unnamed due to privacy laws, was there but not involved in deaths.
lead_paragraph: A German court said a 93-year-old man was charged with 170,000 counts of accessory to murder on allegations he served as an SS guard at the Nazis’ Auschwitz death camp in occupied Poland.

headline.main: Germany: Man, 93, Is Charged as Accessory in Auschwitz Murders
headline.print_headline: Germany: Man, 93, Is Charged as Accessory in Auschwitz Murders

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
